ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b la giŋ tà ḿbʉʼʉ twó yé, ńgyá Ezagẅi ne ńtóo, epʉ̀a gwɔ́ nzèm yé tà ńkuʼ pʉ̀a nkÿo lekùɔ. Á gabte penkʉ́ pé, ńná tsɔ́ né Léyà, ńná petsɔ́ né Lǎshÿɛ̂, ḿbiŋ ńná petsɔ́ né megàŋafàʼ pepanzwě pépʉ́a pie é léen ńcʉ́ʼ mezwě pé.
en: Now Jacob looked up and saw Esau coming toward him with four hundred men. So he divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two slave women.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na megàŋafàʼ pepanzwě pépʉ́a pie é léen ńcʉ́ʼ mezwě pé, á tsege wɔ́b lâ gubé yɔ́b, ńnáa mvfò, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńtsege Léyà pâ gubé yé, ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńtsege Lǎshÿɛ̂ pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b.
en: He put the slaves and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ yé máŋwɛ́ cʉa ńgwɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b. Ńgwaa gʉa tà kúu lejʉ́ŋ fɛ̌ we Ezagẅi, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ ngʉ̀a sɔɔnmbʉ́a tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé.
en: He himself went on ahead and bowed to the ground   seven times until he approached his brother.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi kÿote, ńzáʼa yé, ńtáŋte yé, ḿbéle yé kʉ́kʉ́b yé. Pɔ́ yé pú ńdʉa.
en: But Esau ran to meet him, hugged him, threw his arms around him, and kissed him. Then they wept.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi la gyá nzẅìŋ panzwě pâ penkʉ́, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Pɔɔn, ée pawɔ̌ pie ée nzèm gù?» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ée gubé gie e Ssé ka lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m yé, ńná né mèŋ, mèŋ ngàŋafàʼ gù.»
en: When Esau looked up and saw the women and children, he asked, “Who are these with you? ”

ngiemboon: Megàŋafàʼ pé pepanzwě pâ gubé yɔ́b tó yɔ́b, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé.
en: Then the slaves and their children approached him and bowed down.

ngiemboon: Léyà pâ penkʉ́ pé tó yɔ́b, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Lǎshÿɛ̂ tó yɔ́b, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé.
en: Leah and her children also approached and bowed down, and then Joseph and Rachel approached and bowed down.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi zɛ́te yé ngie: «Agi nùɔ menɔ̀ɔn gie m bumté li, á lɔgɔ ngie kɔ́?» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N dɔgɔ ńtóo pɛ́ʼɛ̀, ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m jú, ńkẅé wɔ́ɔn mboŋó me ndè wɔ̀ɔn.»
en: So Esau said, “What do you mean by this whole procession   I met? ”  # 33:8 Gn 32:13–16

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi gɔɔn ngie: «Atsɔ́ mmó té ne ńzága wɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mbà fɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn. Leʼe shúm shú.»
en: “I have enough, my brother,” Esau replied. “Keep what you have.”

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn púʼu, Yakwɔ̂b tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ngǎŋ, tsetsɔ́ʼ, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge lɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m jú, é kẅé wɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ zẅíŋe mmó nanǎ gie n nǎ lɛ̂. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà n dɔ̌g pɔ́ ntí gie mé lɔg ńtóo mvfò Ssé, ńtóo mvfò gù. Ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńkẅé wɔ́ɔn mboŋó.
en: But Jacob said, “No, please! If I have found favor with you, take this gift from me. For indeed, I have seen your face, and it is like seeing God’s face, since you have accepted me.

ngiemboon: Shúshu, zẅíŋe mmó nanǎ gie n nǎ né gù. Ńtí nue e Ssé ka cÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo n gwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó.»
en: Please take my present that was brought to you, because God has been gracious to me and I have everything I need.” So Jacob urged him until he accepted.

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi gɔɔn né Yakwɔ̂b ngie: «Pege zye légiŋ, pɔ̀gɔ ge gwɔ́ kwò.»
en: Then Esau said, “Let’s move on, and I’ll go ahead of you.”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Andè wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ ne ńzsé ngie á zɛ́te lézɔ́bte gubé zɔbté. N gẅiin mezwě menjʉ̀njÿò pâ mezwě mefòŋ pie é nyé ne ńnóŋo púɔ nǒŋ. Pege lɔɔn ńgÿo pɔ́ giŋ lê tʉ̀ tsɔ̌ ntí, mbɔɔ na tàʼa lyɛ̌ʼ, mbà pɔ́ ge pú kwéte.
en: Jacob replied, “My lord knows that the children are weak, and I have nursing flocks and herds. If they are driven hard for one day, the whole herd will die.

ngiemboon: Shúshu me ndè, gwɔ́ mvfò, mèŋ ngàŋafàʼ gù, n gwɔ́ nzèm, ńne ńgiŋe ndɔɔn ndɔɔn na ntí gie menɔ̀ɔn ée mvfò mèŋ ńne ńgiŋe yɔ́b púʼu. Mbɔɔ na ntí gie e gubé ne ńgiŋe yɔ́b púʼu. N ge ké giŋ pɔ́ púʼu tà láʼ kúu mbʉ̀a gù á Seyî.»
en: Let my lord go ahead of his servant. I will continue on slowly, at a pace suited to the livestock and the children, until I come to my lord at Seir.”

ngiemboon: Ezagẅi gɔɔn ngie: «N ge nyé tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn pi lâ pɔ̌ gwɔ́ kwò.» Yakwɔ̂b tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Púʼu mélàʼakɔ́? Shúshu me ndè, ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ pòŋontʉ́m jú nzèm mèŋ.»
en: Esau said, “Let me leave some of my people with you.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, Ezagẅi piŋ tà ńkúu Seyî,
en: That day Esau started on his way back to Seir,

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na Yakwɔ̂b, mbà à la gʉa Sukɔd, ńkwɛ́ɛ tàʼ ndá, é gwɔ́ ye. Ḿbiŋ ńkwɛ́ menkáʼ, é gwɔ́ me menɔ̀ɔn pé. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, mé tóŋo jʉʼó lê Sukɔd, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie nkáʼa menɔ̀ɔn.
en: but Jacob went to Succoth. He built a house for himself and shelters for his livestock; that is why the place was called Succoth.  ,# 33:17 Jos 13:27; Jdg 8:5; Ps 60:6

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b la fó kwòŋo Alam, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Sishÿɛ̂m á Kánàhan té lɔ̌ʼ, ńkwɛ́ mbʉ̀a ye á ncú tÿǒsoŋ.
en: After Jacob came from Paddan-aram, he arrived safely   at Shechem  # 33:18 Jos 24:1; Jdg 9:1; Ps 60:6; Ac 7:16 in the land of Canaan and camped in front of the city.

ngiemboon: À la lɔg tsɔ̌ ntí nkáb pàg nkÿo, ńjúu jʉʼʉ tsetsáʼ gie à la kwɛ́ mentàb mé wó, á mbwó míŋ Amɔɔ gẅie aa tá pà Sishÿɛ̂m.
en: He purchased a section of the field where he had pitched his tent from the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred pieces of silver.  ,# 33:19 Jos 24:32; Jn 4:5

ngiemboon: Ńnyɛte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńná lezíŋ lê Ɛɛ-Elohe-Ésàlayɛ (ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie «Ɛɛ ée Ssé, é Ssé Ésàlayɛ»).
en: And he set up an altar there and called it God, the God of Israel.
